policy: ALL tasks and subtasks contained within this blueprint MUST be completed in their entirety. Deferring, skipping, or omitting any part of the plan is strictly prohibited. Every unit defined here represents a mandatory component of the final delivery. 'Effective test coverage' means covering ALL code paths, edge cases, and error conditions - not just line coverage. This includes unreachable paths, error branches, and platform-specific code.

coverageDefinition.effectiveCoverage: Coverage of all logic paths, error branches, edge cases, and platform-specific code. Must handle null/undefined inputs, error propagation, concurrent access, and boundary conditions.

targetMetrics.errorPathCoverage: 100% not inclusive of TRULY unreachable code i.e. invariant assertions

chunkTasks.title: Review Eventloop Core Module - First Iteration
chunkTasks.description: Run #runSubagent with prompt: 'Ensure, or rather GUARANTEE the correctness of the Eventloop Core Module - specifically loop.go (1699 lines), js.go, promise.go, timer pool, metrics, and performance optimizations. Since you're _guaranteeing_ it, sink commensurate effort; you care deeply about keeping your word, after all. Even then, I expect you to think very VERY hard, significantly harder than you might expect. Assume, from start to finish, that there's _always_ another problem, and you just haven't caught it yet. Question all information provided - _only_ if it is simply impossible to verify are you allowed to trust, and if you trust you MUST specify that (as briefly as possible). Provide a succinct summary then more detailed analysis. Your succinct summary must be such that removing any single part, or applying any transformation or adjustment of wording would make it materially worse. Write up your review to ./eventloop/docs/reviews/21-CHUNK2-EVENTLOOP_CORE.md.'

chunkTasks.title: Fix all issues identified in Eventloop Core Module review
chunkTasks.description: Use #runSubagent to ADDRESS _all_ issues from the review. Do not proceed until task CHUNK_2.1 shows the review is complete and issues are documented. Run 'make test' after all fixes and verify 100% test pass rate including stress tests.

chunkTasks.title: Re-review Eventloop Core Module - Second Iteration
chunkTasks.description: Run #runSubagent with SAME review prompt (different sequence: 22-CHUNK2-EVENTLOOP_CORE.md) to verify Eventloop Core Module is PERFECT. If review finds ANY remaining issues, mark tasks CHUNK_2.1, CHUNK_2.2, and CHUNK_2.3 for this chunk as 'not-started' again and restart this chunk review cycle. Only mark complete when review is flawless with zero issues.

chunkTasks.title: Fix CRITICAL #1 - Timer ID MAX_SAFE_INTEGER panic
chunkTasks.description: Fix the critical bug where MAX_SAFE_INTEGER check happens AFTER timer is scheduled in SetTimeout (js.go:195-212). Move the validation check to occur BEFORE calling ScheduleTimer to prevent resource leaks. Note: SetInterval and SetImmediate already check BEFORE scheduling (they are safe). Fix: Peek the nextTimerID value, check if > maxSafeInteger, if so return error instead of panic, then call ScheduleTimer.
fixes: CRITICAL #1: Timer ID MAX_SAFE_INTEGER panic with resource leak (js.go:209)

chunkTasks.title: Document HIGH #1 - Interval state TOCTOU race
chunkTasks.description: Evaluate the TOCTOU race condition in SetInterval wrapper and ClearInterval. Current implementation uses double-check locking and is defensive. Determine if this matches JavaScript setInterval/clearInterval semantics (where cancellation is immediate but asynchronous). If correct behavior, add clarifying comments to document the race condition and expected behavior. If not correct, implement proper synchronization.
chunkTasks.fixStatus: VERIFIED 2026-01-25 - DOCUMENTED AS ACCEPTABLE JS SEMANTICS

chunkTasks.title: Fix HIGH #2 - Fast path starvation window
chunkTasks.description: Fix the starvation window where tasks in auxJobs may not execute if the loop exits fast path mode. The issue is in the poll() function (loop.go:830-900) which does not call drainAuxJobs() when not in fast path. Add drainAuxJobs() call in the poll path when fast path is not active to prevent task starvation.

chunkTasks.title: Verify EVENTLOOP CORE fixes and create documentation

chunkTasks.fixStatus: VERIFIED 2026-01-25 - ALL TESTS PASS, DOCUMENTATION CREATED

testCoverageTasks.title: Achieve 100% Effective Test Coverage - Eventloop Module
testCoverageTasks.description: Achieve 100% effective test coverage for eventloop module. Current coverage: 77.1% main, 69.3% alternateone, 58.0% alternatethree, 73.0% alternatetwo. REQUIREMENTS: (1) All code paths covered, (2) All error branches tested, (3) All edge cases covered, (4) Platform-specific code tested where possible, (5) Race condition coverage with -race flag. TARGET METRICS: main >= 90%, alternateone >= 90%, alternatethree >= 85% (experimental), alternatetwo >= 90%. SUBTASKS: (a) Analyze uncovered lines in internal/alternatethree, (b) Add tests for uncovered paths, (c) Verify with 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/...', (d) Run 'go tool cover -html=coverage.out' to visualize gaps, (e) Repeat until all metrics met.

verification.command: go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/... && go tool cover -func=coverage.out | grep total

subtasks.title: Analyze coverage gaps in internal/alternatethree (58.0%)
subtasks.description: Run 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/internal/alternatethree/...' and 'go tool cover -html=coverage.out' to identify specific uncovered lines. Document all gaps in ./eventloop/docs/coverage-gaps-alternatethree.md.

subtasks.title: Add tests for uncovered paths in alternateone and alternatetwo
subtasks.description: Create targeted tests for uncovered code paths in internal/alternateone (69.3%) and internal/alternatetwo (73.0%). Focus on error conditions, edge cases, and platform-specific branches.

subtasks.title: Add error path and edge case tests for main package
subtasks.description: For the 22.9% uncovered in main package, add comprehensive tests for: (a) Timer ID overflow scenarios, (b) Promise error propagation, (c) Metrics edge cases, (d) Fast path boundary conditions, (e) Microtask budget exhaustion.

subtasks.title: Verify 100% effective coverage achieved
subtasks.description: Run full coverage analysis: 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/... && go tool cover -html=coverage.out -o coverage.html'. Verify target metrics: main >= 90%, alternateone >= 90%, alternatethree >= 85%, alternatetwo >= 90%. Ensure all identified coverage gaps closed.

testCoverageTasks.title: Achieve 100% Effective Test Coverage - Goja-Eventloop Module
testCoverageTasks.description: Achieve 100% effective test coverage for goja-eventloop module. Current coverage: 74.9%. REQUIREMENTS: (1) All code paths covered, (2) All error branches tested, (3) Promise combinator edge cases (null/undefined inputs), (4) Timer ID boundary cases (MAX_SAFE_INTEGER), (5) Concurrent timer scheduling stress tests, (6) Deep promise chain scenarios (>10 .then() calls). TARGET METRICS: main >= 90%. SUBTASKS: (a) Analyze uncovered lines with coverage profile, (b) Add Promise combinator tests for null/undefined/edge cases, (c) Add timer ID boundary tests (near MAX_SAFE_INTEGER), (d) Add concurrent timer stress tests, (e) Add deep promise chain tests, (f) Verify with 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./goja-eventloop/...', (g) Run 'go tool cover -html=coverage.out' to visualize gaps.

subtasks.title: Analyze coverage gaps in goja-eventloop (74.9%)
subtasks.description: Run 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./goja-eventloop/...' and 'go tool cover -html=coverage.out' to identify specific uncovered lines. Document all gaps in ./goja-eventloop/docs/coverage-gaps.md.

subtasks.title: Add Promise combinator edge case tests
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive tests for Promise combinators (all, race, allSettled, any) covering: null inputs, undefined inputs, empty arrays, single element arrays, nested promises, mixed resolution/rejection scenarios. Test file: adapter_combinators_edge_test.go

subtasks.title: Add timer ID boundary tests

subtasks.title: Add deep promise chain tests

betteralignTasks.title: Create custom config.mk target for betteralign
betteralignTasks.description: Add a custom target in config.mk for running betteralign on eventloop module. TARGET: 'betteralign-eventloop' with command: 'go -C eventloop tool betteralign -apply .'. This should automatically apply betteralign fixes for cache line padding optimization.

subtasks.title: Create/edit config.mk with betteralign target
Add betteralign target to Makefile
subtasks.description: In project.mk or Makefile, add 'betteralign-eventloop' as a dependency of the 'betteralign' target if it doesn't exist yet. Ensure it integrates with existing build targets.

betteralignTasks.title: Run betteralign on eventloop module
betteralignTasks.description: Execute the betteralign target using #make tool with custom target defined in config.mk. Command: 'make betteralign-eventloop'. Pipe output to build.log as per operational discipline.

betteralignTasks.title: Verify cache line padding is sane after betteralign
betteralignTasks.description: After betteralign applies changes, verify that cache line padding is still correct and doesn't introduce false sharing. REQUIREMENTS: (1) Check that hot data structures remain properly padded, (2) Verify no struct size changes that would affect cache line alignment, (3) Run stress tests to ensure no performance regression, (4) Check that betteralign didn't add excessive padding that wastes memory. VERIFICATION: 'make test' with benchmark comparison. Document any structural changes in ./eventloop/docs/betteralign-verification.md.

subtasks.title: Review betteralign changes
subtasks.description: Use 'git diff' to see what betteralign changed. Look for: struct field reordering, padding additions, size changes. Verify changes are minimal and targeted for cache line optimization.

subtasks.title: Run stress tests to verify no performance regression
subtasks.description: Run 'make test -run Stress' and compare benchmarks before/after betteralign. Look for latency changes, throughput changes, or unexpected performance degradation.

subtasks.title: Document verification results
subtasks.description: Create ./eventloop/docs/betteralign-verification.md documenting: (a) Changes made by betteralign, (b) Performance metrics comparison, (c) Cache line padding verification, (d) Conclusion on whether padding is still sane.

tasks.title: GOJA SCOPE REVIEW SUMMARY (Documented)
tasks.description: Review task already completed. Review document: ./eventloop/docs/reviews/21-GOJA_SCOPE-CHUNK1_CHUNK4.md (dated 2026-01-25). CHUNK_1 and CHUNK_4 have been reviewed and CRITICAL BLOCKING ISSUES identified. Review tasks: CHUNK_1.1, CHUNK_1.3, CHUNK_4.1, CHUNK_4.3 documented in chunkTasks.

tasks.title: Fix all CRITICAL issues in Goja Scope
tasks.description: Fix ALL CRITICAL and HIGH priority issues identified in the Goja Scope review (CHUNK_1 + CHUNK_4): (CRITICAL #1) Remove or validate recursive unwrapping logic in gojaFuncToHandler to preserve Promise.reject(promise) semantics per JS spec. (CRITICAL #2) Add explicit cleanup for Promise wrappers to prevent memory leaks. (HIGH #1) Make iterator error handling consistent across all Promise combinators. Run 'make test' after all fixes and verify 100% test pass rate for goja-eventloop module. DO NOT proceed until all tests pass.

subtasks.title: Fix CRITICAL #1: Recursive unwrapping in gojaFuncToHandler
subtasks.description: Analyze and fix potential recursive unwrapping in gojaFuncToHandler (case *goeventloop.ChainedPromise). Preserve Promise.reject(promise) semantics where rejection reason MUST be the Promise object itself, not its result. Verify JS spec compliance: rejection reason should not be unwrapped to result.

subtasks.title: Fix CRITICAL #2: Promise wrapper cleanup
subtasks.description: Add explicit cleanup for Promise wrappers. Identify where Promise wrappers are created and ensure proper cleanup mechanisms exist to prevent memory leaks in long-running event loops.

subtasks.title: Fix HIGH #1: Iterator error handling consistency
subtasks.description: Review iterator error handling across all Promise combinators (all, race, allSettled, any). Ensure consistent error propagation and handling. Test with edge cases: arrays with rejected promises, mixed resolution/rejection scenarios, null/undefined values.

subtasks.title: Verify all tests pass after fixes
subtasks.description: After completing all fix subtasks, run full test suite: 'go test ./goja-eventloop/... -v' and 'go test ./goja-eventloop/... -race'. Verify 100% pass rate with no failures, no panics, no race conditions.

tasks.title: Re-review Goja Scope for perfection - SECOND ITERATION
tasks.description: After all CRITICAL issues are fixed and verified, run comprehensive re-review of CHUNK_1 (Goja Integration) and CHUNK_4 (Specification Compliance) to ensure NO REMAINING ISSUES. Use #runSubagent with review prompt: 'Ensure, or rather GUARANTEE the correctness of FIXED Goja Integration and Specification Compliance code. Since you're _guaranteeing_ it, sink commensurate effort. Verify: (1) No recursive unwrapping in gojaFuncToHandler, (2) Promise wrappers have explicit cleanup, (3) Iterator error handling is consistent, (4) JS Spec compliance for Promise.reject(promise) semantics, (5) All goja-eventloop tests pass 100%. Write up your review to ./eventloop/docs/reviews/23-GOJA_SCOPE-FIXES-REVIEW.md.' If re-review finds ANY remaining issues, mark REPAIR_1.2 as 'not-started' again and restart fix cycle. Only mark complete when review is flawless with zero issues.

continuousVerificationTasks.title: Run make-all-with-log CONTINUOUSLY
continuousVerificationTasks.description: Run 'make all' with full logging output after every significant change to ensure builds remain stable. Target: build.log. COMMAND: 'make all 2>&1 | fold -w 200 | tee build.log | tail -n 15'. This is a CONTINUOUS task - must be run after: (a) Each code change, (b) Each test addition, (c) Each review cycle completion, (d) Each bug fix. FAIL POLICY: If ANY test fails, STOP. Do not proceed. Fix the issue immediately. Zero tolerance for test failures, even due to timing or non-determinism.

continuousVerificationTasks.title: Run make-all-in-container CONTINUOUSLY
continuousVerificationTasks.description: Run 'make all' in Docker container to verify cross-platform compatibility. This ensures code works correctly in clean environment. This is a CONTINUOUS task - must be run periodically (every 5-10 code changes) and certainly before release. COMMAND: 'make all-in-container' (or equivalent docker-compose command). FAIL POLICY: If container build fails or tests fail in container environment, STOP. Fix environment-specific issues immediately. Zero tolerance for platform-specific failures.

userRequestedVerification.title: USER REQUESTED: Verify 5 Critical Safety Violation Fixes in goja-eventloop
userRequestedVerification.description: Verify compilation and test passage for 5 previously completed critical safety fixes. Documentation in VERIFICATION_SUMMARY.md.

tasks.title: Verify CRITICAL #1: Remove ensureLoopThread() fake safety
tasks.description: Code changes verified: 6 ensureLoopThread() calls removed from goja-eventloop/adapter.go. Thread safety documented via loop.Run() execution pattern. Compilation verified: SUCCESS. Tests verified: SetInterval/ClearInterval have WaitGroup counter errors.

tasks.title: Verify CRITICAL #2: Add panic recovery to callback locations
tasks.description: Code changes verified: defer-recover added to setTimeout, setInterval, queueMicrotask in eventloop/js.go. Verified in tests: SetInterval/ClearInterval execute (but have WaitGroup errors).

tasks.title: Verify CRITICAL #3: Add ok checks to type assertions
tasks.description: Code changes verified: Type assertions made safe in promiseConstructorWrapper and gojaWrapPromise. All ok checks added. No test failures from type assertions.

tasks.title: Verify CRITICAL #4: Implement 4 skipped tests
tasks.description: Code changes verified: TestPromiseChain, TestMixedTimersAndPromises, TestContextCancellation, TestConcurrentJSOperations all implemented. TestContextCancellation: PASS. TestPromiseChain/TestMixedTimersAndPromises/TestConcurrentJSOperations: FAIL (Promise chaining broken).

tasks.title: Verify CRITICAL #5: Add cross-thread documentation
tasks.description: Code changes verified: Extensive documentation added to goja-eventloop/README.md. Includes 'Unsafe Scenario' examples and 'What happens if you violate this rule?' section.

tasks.title: Verify BONUS: Bind Promise combinators
tasks.description: Code changes verified: Promise.all(), Promise.race(), Promise.allSettled(), Promise.any() all bound. Tests: All 8 combinator tests PASS (All/Race/AllSettled/Any each have 2 tests). Promise.resolve()/Promise.reject() bound but broken (return promises without methods).

tasks.title: Verify compilation: go build ./goja-eventloop/...
tasks.description: Compilation verified: SUCCESS. No errors, clean build.

tasks.title: Verify tests: go test ./goja-eventloop/...
tasks.description: Tests verified: PARTIAL - 12/15 tests pass (80% pass rate). 3 tests fail/crash due to newly discovered issues: (1) Promise chaining broken, (2) WaitGroup counter errors, (3) Index panic in Promise chains.

tasks.title: Create review document
tasks.description: Review document created: ./eventloop/docs/reviews/06-c-goja-combinators-perfection.md. Documents findings from verification.

tasks.title: Return verification summary to user
tasks.description: Comprehensive summary delivered: VERIFICATION_SUMMARY.md. Includes compilation status (SUCCESS), test results (FAILED), new issues found (3 critical), final verdict (FAILED - blocking issues).

newIssuesDiscovered.title: Promise Chaining Broken
newIssuesDiscovered.description: First .then() works, second .then() fails with 'Object has no member 'then''. gojaWrapPromise() doesn't properly propagate methods through chains. Blocks TestPromiseChain, TestMixedTimersAndPromises, TestConcurrentJSOperations.

newIssuesDiscovered.title: WaitGroup Negative Counter
newIssuesDiscovered.description: 'sync: negative WaitGroup counter' errors in SetInterval tests. Same-goroutine detection using goroutineID() is flawed. Data corruption risk.

newIssuesDiscovered.title: Promise Runtime Panics
newIssuesDiscovered.description: 'panic: index out of range [-1]' followed by re-panic. Tests crash entirely (not just fail). Root cause unknown. TestPromiseChain crashes.

userRequestedVerification.recommendation: Do NOT merge current changes. FixPromise chaining first (highest priority - blocks core functionality), then investigate Promise crashes, then fix WaitGroup counter. Re-run full verification after all fixes completed.

subtasks.statusNote: VERIFIED COMPLETE 2026-01-23: First iteration review identified 4 CRITICAL bugs causing 8/11 test failures (73% failure rate). CRITICAL #1: Type re-wrapping in gojaFuncToHandler() - converts properly, then re-wraps as opaque object (CAUSES 8/8 FAILURES). CRITICAL #2: Timeout symptoms from CRITICAL #1 (NOT A SEPARATE BUG). CRITICAL #3: Missing null checks in Promise.all/race/any/allSettled before calling ToObject(). CRITICAL #4: Promise.resolve() needs defensive null/undefined handling. Review document: ./eventloop/docs/reviews/07-GOJA_INTEGRATION_COMBINATORS.md

subtasks.title: Fix all issues identified in Goja Integration & Combinators review
subtasks.description: Fix ALL 4 CRITICAL bugs from review: (1) Type re-wrapping in gojaFuncToHandler(), (2) Missing null checks in Promise.all/race/any/allSettled, (3) Promise.resolve() null/undefined handling. Test verification: 11 tests currently failing (8 timeouts, 3 type errors). Must achieve 100% pass rate.

subtasks.title: Fix CRITICAL #1: Type re-wrapping in gojaFuncToHandler()
subtasks.description: Fix gojaFuncToHandler() to check result type at Go-native level BEFORE calling JavaScript handlers, avoiding double-wrapping. This causes 8/8 test failures with opaque wrapper objects.
subtasks.statusNote: VERIFIED COMPLETE 2026-01-23: Added switch statement in gojaFuncToHandler() to handle []goeventloop.Result and map[string]interface{} before calling convertToGojaValue(). This prevents Goja's Export() from re-wrapping as opaque objects.

subtasks.title: Fix CRITICAL #2 & #3: Missing null checks in Promise combinators
subtasks.description: Add defensive null/undefined checks before ToObject() in Promise.all(), Promise.race(), Promise.allSettled(), Promise.any(). This causes TypeError in tests.
subtasks.statusNote: VERIFIED COMPLETE 2026-01-23: Added goja.IsUndefined(lengthVal) checks to all four combinators (Promise.all, Promise.race, Promise.allSettled, Promise.any). This prevents TypeError when length is undefined.

subtasks.title: Fix CRITICAL #4: Promise.resolve() null/undefined handling
subtasks.description: Add defensive null/undefined handling to Promise.resolve() identity semantics check.
subtasks.statusNote: VERIFIED COMPLETE 2026-01-23: Added null/undefined guards at the start of Promise.resolve() handler. Returns resolved promise with nil value for null/undefined, avoiding ToObject() panic.

subtasks.title: Verify all 11 combinator tests pass
subtasks.description: Run go test ./goja-eventloop/... -v and verify 100% pass rate (0/11 failures). Report before/after test results.
subtasks.statusNote: FIXED 2026-01-23: All syntax errors in adapter.go fixed. Removed safeWrapValue() call (undefined function). Rewrote allSettled to use simple pattern matching (goja.IsNull() instead of gojaVal.IsNull(), remove broken switch/else pattern). Compilation verified: SUCCESS (0 errors). Ready to run 7.C.2.4 test verification.

subtasks.title: Review Documentation & Final (Groups 14 + CI/Config)
subtasks.description: Use runSubagent with prompt: 'Ensure, or rather GUARANTEE the correctness of my PR - specifically all documentation (READMEs, godoc) and CI configuration. Since you're _guaranteeing_ it, sink commensurate effort; you care deeply about keeping your word, after all. Even then, I expect you to think very VERY hard, significantly harder than you might expect. Assume, from start to finish, that there's _always_ another problem, and you just haven't caught it yet. Question all information provided - _only_ if it is simply impossible to verify are you allowed to trust, and if you trust you MUST specify that (as briefly as possible). Provide a succinct summary then more detailed analysis. Your succinct summary must be such that removing any single part, or applying any transformation or adjustment of wording, would make it materially worse. Write up your review to ./eventloop/docs/reviews/11-DOCUMENTATION_FINAL.md.'
